items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds the deepfilter-ladspa package, as well as nixos modules for using it and/or rnnoise with pipewire.

Closes #236646.

I've tested the modules on my own nixos system.

items.content_html:
Motivation

This fixes a warning that's been bothering me.

warning: Nix search path entry '/nix/var/nix/profiles/per-user/root/channels' does not exist, ignoring
Description of changes

  • Allow users to remove nix-channel and its accompanying files. Opt-in.

    configuration.nix:

     nix.channel.enable = false;

  • Extends the installer test case to make sure users can switch from a traditional config to a flake.

Closes #192667

items.title: nixos/minio: allow distributed nodes

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Adds a postResumeCommands option to the initramfs to allow inserting code to execute after the device has attempted to resume, and before filesystems are mounted.

This allows to inject code for operations like wiping the rootfs on boot; if those were instead put in postDeviceCommands, on a hibernated device, they would execute before the device resumes from hibernation. The next currently available spot is postMountCommands which is too late.

Currently, impermanence setups recommend using postDeviceCommands, see:
https://grahamc.com/blog/erase-your-darlings/
https://mt-caret.github.io/blog/posts/2020-06-29-optin-state.html

Things done

items.content_html:
Description of changes

The checkPhase script that runs nft --check uses libredirect to link
/etc/services and /etc/protocols inside the sandbox. The problem is that it
resets NIX_REDIRECTS after running the user-provided preCheckRuleset, so
it's not possible to add more redirects.

This adds the generated /etc/hosts as well, needed to resolve static hostnames,
and a :$NIX_REDIRECTS to make this extensible.

Things done
  • Tested via:
    • nixosTests.nat.nftables
    • nixosTests.firewall
  • Checked the manual with nix build -f nixos/release.nix manual.x86_64-linux
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)

items.content_html:
We use postgres quite a bit and upgrading from old versions has proven to be too manual.

The goal here is to automate the pg_upgrade process to ease postgres version changes.

Description of changes

This adds upgradeFrom and analyzeAfterUpgrade options to services.postgresql.

upgradeFrom is used to specify an optional postgres package to upgrade from. For example:

config.services.postgresql.package = pkgs.postgresql_15;

config.services.postgresql.upgradeFrom = {
  package = pkgs.postgresql_11;
  dataDir = "/var/lib/postgresql/11.1";
};

Will upgrade from 11.1 to 15 on the next nixos-rebuild during the pre-start script.
If the old data dir is either missing or marked as upgraded, the upgrade script is noop.

The package is required since pg_upgrade requires paths to old binaries.

When specified, analyzeAfterUpgrade will run vacuumdb --all --analyze-in-stages as postgres suggests when pg_upgrade is done in the post-start script.

Comes with accompanying nixos test and documentation changes on upgrades.

Things done

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is an alternative to #241973 and is basically directly lifted from https://github.com/Dali99/nixos-matrix-modules just minus the automatic worker provisioning and nginx config.

This has been sitting 99% done for a while now so the above PR made me dust it off.

The main differences between the two implementations seem to be:

#241973:

workers = {
  enable = true;
  config = [
    { worker_name = "federation_sender";
      ...
    }
  ];
};
  • Automatically configures a redis socket for the workers
  • Automatically adds the main replication listener to the instance_map(!)

While this alternative:

workers.instances = {
  federation_sender.settings = { ... };
};
  • Defaults to select any replication listener (even if you change the listener configuration).
  • Only enables redis on the synapse side automatically when you have workers (without configuring it)

And lastly it'd be a lot easier for me to execute my plan for upstreaming the automatic workers and opionated nginx config stuff in later PRs 😅

The redis socket stuff and instance_map stuff are good ideas (and didn't exist when this was fist ported). so I'll implement that as well later. But wanted to open this to get some preliminary review/discussion

@999eagle

items.content_html:
These seemingly misguided comments were added by 6559283, and are the source of the confusion in #194594 and #222236.

For reference, Android ships on devices with 400-500 DPI displays, and still makes use of greyscale anti-aliasing. It does not use subpixel AA which does hit diminishing returns at high resolutions, but can cause visible artifacts (at 300 DPI, we already have three times more pixels than a standard density display, catching up with the effective subpixel resolution of those screens).

For a subjective reference point, I already find subpixel anti-aliasing ineffective on a ~100 DPI monitor, and the color fringing is noticeable and intrusive.

According to 1, the v40 TrueType interpreter does not do subpixel hinting. Instead, it aligns to whole pixels. This helps with sharpness, and I have no reason to believe that it is harmful at higher resolutions.
It is still useful on displays that are between standard (96 DPI) and "retina" (250-300+ DPI) density. These are generally considered high-DPI because they require scaling. For example, a 14" 1080p laptop, or a 27" 4k monitor are around 150 DPI.

    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.05 Release Notes (or backporting 22.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/fastnetmon-advanced: init
